replies.body:
http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/929/167/515.gif
Also, this gif is now officially ancient
You have no one to blame but yourself since you are the one who is posting it so much. ; )
http://m.imgur.com/gallery/vB9B5?noredirect

Rehost it a couple more times to really emphasize its age.

https://i.imgur.com/1HvNiEO.png?noredirect

I shall now set my top goal in life as making this gif even older than the memes it is posted on
https://media4.giphy.com/media/W8JIqASjSwtcA/giphy.gif

> [{quoted}](name=hoes and bows,realm=EUNE,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=TJ24bYnK,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-07-23T15:13:08.371+0000)
>
> http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/929/167/515.gif
> Also, this gif is now officially ancient

Well it IS from a long, long time ago.
Wait. . . .who is that champion? The one who dropped the ball on top lane? Who is that?
I think it's a "Galio"

Bullshit.

It's obviously the new Champion.

Galio is this crab guy who shoots around green rockets.
I'm sorry for disagreeing with you, great sir, but I suggest Galio might be the well known italian 16th century philosopher.
I do believe you are thinking of Galileo Galilei, a Galio is a structure, typically of two uprights and a crosspiece, for the hanging of criminals, used in the medieval ages.
No, no sir, I do believe what you are referring to is a gallows.  I'm quite certain a Galio is a square rigged ship with 3 or 4 decks used primarily in the 15-17th centuries.

> [{quoted}](name=3SheetsTotheWind,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=TJ24bYnK,comment-id=000300000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-07-23T18:07:02.376+0000)
>
> No, no sir, I do believe what you are referring to is a gallows.  I'm quite certain a Galio is a square rigged ship with 3 or 4 decks used primarily in the 15-17th centuries.

No, no sir, I do  believe what you're referring to is a galley. I'm quite sure a Galio is a large room in which various works of art are kept for display.
Not quite good sir, If I'm not mistaken I do believe a Galio is unit of measurement equal to 4 quarts, or 8 Pints, or 16 Cups.

Sir, you are most kind to assist us but I think you are at a fault here. What you are talking about is a Gallon.
A Galio is a short bladed weapon used by ancient Romans both in the battlefield by soldiers and occasionally in amphitheaters by gladiators.
No sir, I think that is a gladius. A Galio is a ship similar to the Galley, except with sails instead of oars.
My most esteemed colleague, I do believe you are referring to a gundalow, a Galio is the alternative evolved form of the Pokemon Kirlia.
My Good Sir, I do believe you are referring to a Gallade, a Galio is a Psychotic Robot that runs an abandoned Science Laboratory.
If I may interject my dear fellow, I believe you are referring to GLADOS.  A Galio is a cluster of billions of stars.
Excuse me, If  may intercede you are referring to a galaxy. A Galio is a a book in the New Testament, written to the Christians in Galatia.

> [{quoted}](name=Celestial Lion12,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=TJ24bYnK,comment-id=00030000000000000000000000000000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-07-24T21:44:13.302+0000)
>
> Excuse me, If  may intercede you are referring to a galaxy. A Galio is a a book in the New Testament, written to the Christians in Galatia.

I am sorry, brother, you are thinking of Galatians. Galio is a very strong wind, usually occurring at sea
**
*edit* **: dammit we have reached the the thread hierarchy limit, had to use the archaic quote system

I'm sorry sir you are quite far from the truth, I believe that a galio is a large man who yells demacia constantly while dealing 1% max health true damage every 0.3 seconds  while also stopping me from using any abilities
No, I think what you are referring to is an asshole.
BEST COMMENT 2016!
COMBO BREAKER!!!

No, a Galio has wings, a tail, and turns to stone once in a while. This is a Galio

http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/gargoyles/images/4/4e/Goliath.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20070617162315

Yorick

duh
http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/992/407/776.jpg
ANOTHER BEST COMMENT 2016!
https://media.riffsy.com/images/985e378dcc816804edebca4e801b0e22/raw
Kled

> [{quoted}](name=Embertine,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=TJ24bYnK,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-07-23T16:19:43.723+0000)
>
> Wait. . . .who is that champion? The one who dropped the ball on top lane? Who is that?

I think it's the aatrox rework...? Wait who's aatrox? Is he the yorick rework..?!?!?
This was pretty much the only decent CTRL+Alt+Del comic.

huh I thought I was the only one who saw CTRL ALT DEL as tasteless

mostly because I don't search up stuff about a comic before reading it
https://media4.giphy.com/media/r35VO5DnOV8ty/giphy.gif
So this is why Yorick isn't in free week rotation anymore...he broke the cycle and ascended. Similar to Buddhist reincarnation cycle.
So THATS what happens when the servers go down

Oh, I thought things were more **_fun_** when the server go down

-wink wink nudge nudge-
People play Yorick?

Sometimes- bear in mind- 9/10 LoL players will not have the slightest idea of what to do against you once you get your tear.

They can't poke you out of lane- you sustain better than they do.
They can't 1v1 you- that's just asking for you to set 3 ghouls on them to pile on the damage.
They can't trade with you- W+E slows them, hurts them, heals you- and then the trade is over or you're whacking them with a shovel.
They can't kill you- you're very difficult to kill- and even if they do you've got your ghost to jump them with.

Yorick is actually hella strong in the right hands.

He is litterally the best Toplaner in lane. So of course people cant beat him, unless their name is Trundle maybe.

You beat a Yorick by accepting you auto-lost lane and abuse his weak af midgame.
I always read Yorick in Dyrus's voice
Wait, who's that last guy?
Then Yorick was removed from the game

Holy shit I remember seeing this two years ago. 

Glad to see it back {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
